sub_title: Mission Security & Accreditation Engineer (RHEA Group for ESA - European Space Agency)
summary:
Current Division/Section/Unit:
- DG-5X ( ESA Director's General Service - ESO - ESA Security Office)

Current Role:
Mission Security and Accreditation Engineer:
- Security Accreditation of ESA Space Programs (Galileo, SAGA and IRIS2)
- Cyber Security and IT Security
- Classified Engineering of Space Systems: Design, Development, Qualification, Integration and Deployment
- Security Support to Ground Segment Procurement

General Tasks: 
- Classified Engineering: Security Accreditation and Certification, Cyber Security, Information Security. 
- System Security Architecture and Security Requirement engineering

System, Space and Segment Security Accreditation Tasks:
- ESA Point of Contact for system and segment design reviews for security, accreditation, and certification aspects: System and Segment Vulnerability Assessment, Risk Analysis, Threat Scenarios coverage. 
- Preparation, implementation and follow up of the Core infrastructure accreditation dossier (process, documentation, interaction with industrial stakeholders and International Councils) at system and segment level
- Development, review and final issue of System and Segments Security Risk Analysis, Security Accreditation Strategy, and other cyber security related vulnerabilities
- Definition, analysis and consolidation of System and Segment security, cyber security, and accreditation requirements at system and segment level.

Cyber Security tasks: 
- Risk analysis for cyber security aspects related to Mission and Security Accreditation: real time threats, vulnerabilities assessment, risk analysis, mitigation strategy, countermeasures implementation policy, calculation of residual risk, technical assessment of proposed solution in coordination with Segment Prime\N-2 Providers.
- Definition and consolidation of the Cyber Security Monitoring specifications and the procurement of the associated ground and space segment infrastructure.

profile_positions.description:
- Guiding and recommending to the Programmes/Projects in the area of Security Management, Security Risk Management, Controls and countermeasures with respect to the applicability of the ESA Security Regulations and Directives and Project-specific security needs.
- Generating and reviewing the Project End-to-End Mission Security Risk Analysis and review the detailed Security Risk Assessment for each relevant Milestone of the Project/Programme.
- Contributing to the definition of the minimum set of Security Requirements to grant the level of assurance of the Mission in terms of availability, integrity and confidentiality of the information, based on the outcome of the security risk analysis and the review of existing project documentation.
- Providing guidance on the proper definition of the system security architecture and mission-level operational concepts.
- Reviewing the relevant documentation, in terms of the System Security Requirements, the System Security Design and its achievement of the Mission Requirements to an appropriate level of protection.
- Monitoring the correct implementation of the system/segment, SSRS, security measures, design, and qualification, with the target to control, or decrease, the residual risk of the configuration(s) of the system(s) to be deployed.
- Supporting the definition and review the implementation of the cybersecurity monitoring and security response for the Project/Programme.
- Reviewing and monitoring the Project security testing, verification, qualification and certification, where possible exploiting the ESA cyber capabilities.
- Supporting auditing and penetration testing in order to monitor and supervise the cybersecurity implementation level.
- Supporting the Accreditation/Certification process during the complete lifecycle for the Project, collating the certification/accreditation files to be submitted to the Certification/Accreditation bodies (either ESO or the EU SAB, as appropriate).

profile_positions.description:
Technical and Managerial aspects of International Space Projects in the frame of Space and Ground Segment Security Accreditation and Certification, Information Security, Cyber Security and Classified Engineering.

Responsibilities and tasks: 
   •	Galileo Security Accreditation engineer; design, development and implementation of security accreditation processes for Ground and Space segments. Review and assessment of accreditation dossiers of Galileo Ground Segment Security Chains (risk analysis and assessments, security integration and validation, security accreditation and certification dossiers), acting as ESA Interface with national accreditation entities and industry stakeholders. 
   •	Cyber Security engineer: Risk analysis, real time threats, assessment of the vulnerabilities, mitigation strategy, countermeasures implementation policy, calculation of residual risk, technical assessment of solution. Interface with industry and external national security entities.
   •	Galileo Ground Control Segment Classified AIV engineer: review, development and implementation of Classified Qualification and Validation process. Full coverage of ECSS standard processes related to the life cycle of requirements (definition, review, acceptation, implementation, qualification, verification and follow up).

  •	Classified Engineering Design and Development: full coverage of the deployment of new Galileo Ground Segment releases in compliancy with ECSS Standards.
   •	 Security Operations: Definition and developing of Security Monitoring procedures and interfaces.

Port Security: Ports of Venice and Marghera, Versalis chemical Plant, ENI Group
ISPS Code Maritime Security Audits, Assessments and Analysis of the Port Security Risk Activities: Onsite Surveys, Audits, Assessments, Analysis; countermeasures identification and definition; design of Security Plans.
